CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 5, 1958, pg. 4 reads: "The Seventh Annual Courier Home Service Fair attracted more than 10,000 homemakers, students and information seekers despite inclement weather and was acclaimed the most exciting home show ever held in Pittsburgh.  Colorful booths, dazzling displays, appetizing food samples and free prizes kept the (1-2) crowds busy at four sessions held at the Syria Mosque, March 25, 26, 27..."
TitMainTitle: Crowd seated in Syria Mosque with Coca-Cola booth in background, for the 1958 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair
CatSubject_tab: Trade shows--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Crowds--Pennsylvania--Pittsburgh.Syria Mosque (Pittsburgh, Pa.)Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair.
